This question would mostly be for Gordon and Jim as it relates
directly to =
a NTHK Kanteisho, but anyone else who see's fit to throw
in can do.

I have=
 a kanteisho which describes the tsuba theme as Raimon. As I
understand it,=
 in Japanese, Kaminari (雷) means thunder and/or
lightning depending =
on the situation. If we want to distinguish
thunder and lightning, we say R=
aimei (雷鳴) and Inaduma (稲妻)
respectively and Ra=
iden (雷電) for thunderbolt.

But in case of Raimon (雷&#=
25991;), does it mean an old Chinese form or
pattern which seems to express=
 lightning.

Cheers all

Rich
